intro: Calhounia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Calhounia palmeri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
